Content.Name: Required Nursing Courses
Content.Title: Required Nursing Courses
Content.Abstract: There are two Course Sequences in the BSN program the 3 semester and the 6 semester.
Content.BodyCopy:
Students who follow a specific completion plan will attain their degree in the least amount of time. In order to provide flexibility, the plan is divided into Nursing cohorts and Baccalaureate Degree requirements as follows:
  • The 3 or 6-Semester Cohort of Core Nursing Courses
  • The Baccalaureate Degree Completion Plan (B.D.C.P.) including Foundations (G.E.) Courses

* FDMAT 108 Math for the Real World or FDMAT 221, 222 or 223 Statistics is the prerequesite to taking NURS 338 (Having FDMAT 108 waived as a University requirement does NOT waive it as a prerequisite to NURS 338.)

BYU-Idaho General Education / Foundation Baccalaureate Requirements

In addition to the above BSN core courses, students are also required to complete Foundation / General Education courses. On the BSN application, applicants determine the completion sequence of these courses by filling out the Baccalaureate Degree Completion Plan (BDCP).

The following conditions may affect the required course work:

  • The BYU-I catalog year used for requirements
  • The total number of official credits listed on your transcripts
  • The total number of BYU-Idaho Foundation / general education course requirements completed
  • The current articulation agreements between BYU-Idaho and other academic institutions

For clarification specific to university requirements, please consult with the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Academic Discovery Center  (208-496-9830).
